abstract: Iraq's effort to retake Tikrit from Islamic State is aided by American airstrikes as well as by Iranian-backed Shiite militias, though neither United States nor Iran wants to be seen as cooperating with each other.
lead_paragraph: In the battle to retake Tikrit, the Iraqi military served as a go-between for two global adversaries that did not want to publicly acknowledge that they were working together.

headline.main: A U.S. Concession to Reality in the Battle Against Islamic State
headline.print_headline: A U.S. Concession to Reality in the Battle Against Islamic State
